hero: Hi there! My name is *Franco*, I'm a *26 years old* aspiring ¬Front End developer¬ from Buenos Aires, Argentina. I have experience ¬building sites¬ with React, Next, Vue and ~am always on the lookout~ for an excuse to learn a new ¬framework¬ or *library*! Truth be told, I just °love° all things programming; be it games, cool *algorithms* to work around specific problems, AI or modding pretty much anything to make it a more personal experience, I constantly find myself fiddling with *some* type of code. ~Welcome~ to my page!

panels.title: experience
panels.description:
I have worked freelance for a small range of clients like ¬BPM Digital Labs¬ and ~Edesur~ developing websites, as well as teaching programming at ¬Universidad Maimonides¬ for 2 years now.
Check out my ~resume~ for more details!

panels.title: where-i-work
panels.description: I'm currently doing *freelance work* (have been for ~2 years~ now) as well as *volunteering* as a professor at Universidad Maimonides, Argentina. This is where i °studied°, and the professors who taught me are now my ¬colleagues¬! I *love helping out* wherever i can, and i'm a firm ~believer~ that a group of people that support each other in the pursuit of achieving something can outdo any °genius° on any given day.

panels.title: my-projects
panels.description: I have *completed 8 projects* for clients, altough a good part of them were made with tools such as ¬Wordpress¬ or ¬TiendaNube¬, which while I fully respect developers who decide to pursue careers utilizing these ~tools~ to create websites, it's not really for ~Me~. That said, I do have *2 projects* I'm very ~proud of~ that are a great display of my *skills*; one is a °chess app° that showcases inherent *complex logic* and ¬UI handling¬, and the other is a *real world application* for calculating energy supplied under the wrong conditions and their corresponding °penalties° that is being used to this day, saving *millions* of dollars for the company! If you have the time, I'd *love* to tell you all about them!

panels.title: my-journey
panels.description: I've been ¬learning¬ to program for about °6 years° now. My first real interaction with a ¬code editor¬ was on my first year at Universidad Maimonides, Argentina. I wasn't quite sure what I wanted to follow career-wise, so i went for a career that had many aspects I had *interest* in, such as ¬graphic design¬, ~media editing~ (photoshop, premiere, aftereffects, etc), ¬animation¬, °3D Modeling°, and naturally, *programming*. This was, however, not even close in terms of how much the different subjects interested me once i actually got to do some hands on learning. I immediately fell in love with the amount of ¬control¬ I have when coding and just how powerful a *tool* a computer is. I can only wonder what someone like Sir Isaac Newton would have been able to accomplish with a computer, and I'm ~extremely excited~ to see what I can learn from my seniors, whom have walked this path some 10, 20 or even 30+ years ago! I'm currently reaping the rewards of my hard work too. The people who have ¬worked with me¬ have all had very encouraging feedback, particularly in regard to my ~communication skills~. I have also been teaching programming at Universidad Maimonides for two years now. I'm now ready to dive into the world of constant ¬production¬, with a *skillset* that doesn't just involve *programming*, but rather the  full fledged knowledge of a ~Multi-Media developer~ capable of working with, and around, all kinds of professionals that involve *creating* wonderful digital ¬products¬!

panels.title: technologies-and-languages
panels.description: I'm *bilingual*! I can speak and write in both ¬English¬ and *Spanish* at a very proficient level. I am a native Spanish speaker, and am fluent in English.
